@graph.name: Vegan Steak - Nora Cooks
@graph.description: Marinated Vegan Steak made from seitan and lentils is tender, juicy, and packed with protein. Grill them up for an unforgettable summer meal!

@graph.name: Vegan Steak
@graph.description: Tender, juicy, and protein-packed Vegan Steak is made from seitan, lentils, and classic seasonings. Marinated in soy sauce, tomato paste, and maple syrup, the smoky flavors are perfect for summer barbecue season.
recipeIngredient: 3/4 cup cooked lentils  (I used canned, drained and rinsed)

recipeInstructions.text: To a food processor, add all seitan steak ingredients and pulse, scraping down the sides as needed until combined.
recipeInstructions.name: To a food processor, add all seitan steak ingredients and pulse, scraping down the sides as needed until combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Dump the seitan onto a clean surface, sprinkling with a little vital wheat gluten if needed to prevent sticking. Knead the mixture together for a few minutes until it's no longer crumbly.
recipeInstructions.name: Dump the seitan onto a clean surface, sprinkling with a little vital wheat gluten if needed to prevent sticking. Knead the mixture together for a few minutes until it's no longer crumbly.

recipeInstructions.text: Flatten the ball somewhat, then cut into 4 sections. Use a potato masher, or even just your hands to flatten the steaks further. I think they are best when they are quite thin, about an inch or a little less.
recipeInstructions.name: Flatten the ball somewhat, then cut into 4 sections. Use a potato masher, or even just your hands to flatten the steaks further. I think they are best when they are quite thin, about an inch or a little less.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the steaks in a steamer basket with water on the bottom and steam for 30 minutes. You can also wrap each one in foil if desired, but they really turn out fine unwrapped. Make sure the water doesn't all evaporate and add more as needed.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the steaks in a steamer basket with water on the bottom and steam for 30 minutes. You can also wrap each one in foil if desired, but they really turn out fine unwrapped. Make sure the water doesn't all evaporate and add more as needed.

recipeInstructions.text: While the steaks steam, whisk the marinade ingredients in a shallow dish (8x8 is perfect).
recipeInstructions.name: While the steaks steam, whisk the marinade ingredients in a shallow dish (8x8 is perfect).

recipeInstructions.text: Once the steaks are done steaming, remove and place in the marinade. Turn them over a few times to coat.
recipeInstructions.name: Once the steaks are done steaming, remove and place in the marinade. Turn them over a few times to coat.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a large pan (cast iron grill pan preferred) with a few tablespoons of oil. Add the steaks and cook for a few minutes on each side until a bit blackened. You could also cook them on an outdoor grill.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat a large pan (cast iron grill pan preferred) with a few tablespoons of oil. Add the steaks and cook for a few minutes on each side until a bit blackened. You could also cook them on an outdoor grill.

recipeInstructions.text: Brush the steaks with a little more marinade right before removing from the pan for extra flavor and moisture.
recipeInstructions.name: Brush the steaks with a little more marinade right before removing from the pan for extra flavor and moisture.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve immediately with baked potatoes and vegan sour cream, or any other side dishes you like. See the post above for ideas. Enjoy!
